translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Alms
The Elder Muṭṭhipapphula
“My name was Sudassana,
and at that time I was a garland maker.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the chief in the world, the bull of a man.

analyzed: jāti puppham gahetvāna  pūjayim padum uttara
translated: Taking a jasmine flower,🔽I worshipped Padumuttara;
The one with purified vision, the one with a beautiful mind,
the one with the divine eye, the one who was concentrated.
Because of that flower worship,
and because of the aspiration of my mind,
for a hundred thousand eons
I did not go to a bad destination.
There were sixteen kings
named Devuttaras;
thirty-six eons ago,
there were powerful Wheel-turning Monarchs.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Muṭṭhipapphula recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā muṭṭhipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Muṭṭhipupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā muṭṭhipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽muṭṭhipupphiya therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Elder Muṭṭhipapphula’s Birth Story is the fifth.
